Dead By Daylight, while having an initial upfront grind to gain both Killer or Survivor perks (combined with a steep challenge against players who already have these perks), has a fun gameplay routine that draws you back after each match, letting you grow to learn how to play and counterplay each player's abilities and perk loadouts.

But, the DLC's aren't formatted uniformly, so 1/10, would annoy my OCD again.

It's one of those multiplayer horror games, where one person plays the bad guy trying to catch/imprison the other players, who are survivors. But this is a really good example of the genre.

You have an upgrade/level system and items, plus a few clothing articles to customize your character. Every survivor class has  unique skills, some passive, some upgradeable, and some have to be activated; in addition, there are numerous villain classes.
There's even more if you also purchase the DLCs, which are all quite good. 

Going by comments, the biggest criticism of the game is that its community is toxic or takes advantage of unbalanced mechanics. I'm a newbie and a pretty predictable player (which in this game is a disadvantage), but I haven't encountered any negativity (in the GMT and GMT+1 timezone at least). Several times the Killer would let me and another sole survivor win out of pity, several times all four survivors would form a conga line and mess with the Killer xD 

During every round I've played so far, other survivors, even other newbs, are good at signalling and working with you. Roles are assigned and accepted without chat: one player focuses on juking and baiting the killer; another player is the designated rescuer/healer; and the other two focus on getting the generators up and running -- for example.

In fact, for me, this is a big draw to the game: getting along with others and working out an escape plan even without direct communication. 

A word of caution, though: don't jump into the game expecting to play as a clever Killer the first time around. The Killer is the hardest mode to learn and master, and your first couple of times you will most probably lose spectacularly. That's okay though! You can learn from this experience, from guides and from how better Killers behave when you play Survivor. 

On a side-note: there are a few fundamental differences between this game and its unofficial rival, Friday the 13th. Survivors have different abilities, escape routes are different, level design is completely different... It's hard to say which is better. It's like comparing Terraria with Starbound, or Team Fortress 2 with Overwatch.
